means: 彭妮（女子名， Penelope 的昵称）

sentence.Network_en: The directors of this company feel he's worth every penny.
sentence.Network_cn: 这家公司的主管们觉得他值得栽培。

sentence.Network_en: Unleaded gasoline rose more than a penny a gallon.
sentence.Network_cn: 无铅汽油每加仑涨了1分多。

sentence.Network_en: Government penny-pinching is blamed for the decline in food standards.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府吝啬被指责是食品标准下降的原因。

phrase.cizu_name: a bad penny always turns up

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)someone or something unwelcome will always reappear or return
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)讨厌的人（或物）总是会出现（或回来）

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly Brit.)be plentiful or easily obtained and consequently of little value
jx.jx_cn_mean: (主英)太多（或太容易得到）而不值钱

jx.jx_en_mean: (或your penniesbe careful about how much one spends)(或your)be careful about how much one spends

phrase.cizu_name: in for a penny, in for a pound

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express someone's intention to complete an enterprise once it has been undertaken, however much time, effort, or money this entails
jx.jx_cn_mean: 一旦开始就做到底；一不做，二不休

phrase.cizu_name: look after the pennies and the pounds will look af

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)if you concentrate on saving small amounts of money, you'll soon amass a large amount
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)积少成多；注意存小钱很快就可以积累一大笔钱

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Brit.)used to indicate that someone has finally realized or understood something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主英)最后明白了，终于明白了

jx.jx_en_mean: used in spoken English to ask someone what they are thinking about
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于英语口语］你呆呆地在想什么啦！

lj.lj_ly: I paid a pretty penny for that ring.
lj.lj_ls: 我花了一大笔钱买了那个戒指

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English penig, penning of Germanic origin; related to Dutch penning, German Pfennig, perhaps also to pawn and (with reference to shape) pan

encyclopedia.content: 戴佩妮（Penny Tai），马来西亚创作型华语女歌手，舞蹈工作出身，拥有作词、作曲、编曲的能力，擅长弹奏吉他、钢琴等乐器，喜好舞蹈、创作、化妆与摄影。曾与蔡依林、萧亚轩、孙燕姿合称四小天后。2009年5月，发行专辑《原谅我就是这样的女生》。

entry.def: In Britain, a penny is one hundredth of a pound, or a coin worth this amount of money.

example.ex: Cider also goes up by a penny a pint while sparkling wine will cost another eight pence a bottle.
example.tran: 苹果酒每品脱也涨了1便士，而汽酒则每瓶涨了8便士。
新铸造的锃亮的1便士硬币

entry.tran: 便士（英国1971年前使用的硬币，价值1/12先令）
entry.def: A penny is a British coin used before 1971 that was worth one twelfth of a shilling.
A penny is one cent, or a coin worth one cent.

example.ex: Unleaded gasoline rose more than a penny a gallon.
example.tran: 无铅汽油每加仑涨了1分多。

entry.def: If you say, for example, that you do not have a penny, or that something does not cost a penny, you are emphasizing that you do not have any money at all, or that something did not cost you any money at all.

example.ex: From the day you arrive at my house, you need not spend a single penny...
example.tran: 从你到我家那天起，你就一个子儿也不用花。

example.ex: The Brilliantons paid their rent on time and did not owe him a penny...
example.tran: 布里连顿夫妇按时交纳租金，一个子儿也不欠他的。

entry.tran: 恍然大悟；茅塞顿开；突然回过神来
entry.def: If you say the penny dropped, you mean that someone suddenly understood or realized something.

example.ex: 'Did he know who you are?' — 'I think so. I think the penny dropped.'
example.tran: “他知道你是谁吗？”——“我想是的。我觉得他是突然想到的。”

entry.def: If someone says that they are going to spend a penny, they mean that they are going to go to the toilet.
Things that are said to be two a penny or ten a penny are not valuable or interesting because they are very common and easy to find.

example.ex: Leggy blondes are two a penny in Hollywood.
example.tran: 在好莱坞，长腿金发美女遍地都是。

entry.tran: 物有所值；一分钱不白花
entry.def: If you say that something or someone is worth every penny, you mean that they are worth all the money that is spent on them.

example.ex: The operation cost £100,000 and it was worth every penny...
example.tran: 那次手术花了10万英镑，但是花得非常值。

example.ex: The directors of this company feel he's worth every penny.
example.tran: 这家公司的主管们觉得他值得栽培。

means.word_mean: 1. a fractional monetary unit of Ireland and the United Kingdom; equal to one hundredth of a pound
2. a coin worth one-hundredth of the value of the basic unit

auth_sentence.content: We have not received a penny from political parties.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have not received a penny from political parties.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have not received a penny from political parties.

auth_sentence.content: Failing to do so would be penny-wise and pound-foolish.
auth_sentence.res_content: Failing to do so would be penny-wise and pound-foolish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Failing to do so would be penny-wise and pound-foolish.

auth_sentence.content: We've also had Penny Lancaster hosting the show.
auth_sentence.res_content: We've also had Penny Lancaster hosting the show.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We've also had Penny Lancaster hosting the show.

sentences.en: There were nine pounds left, besides some pennies.
sentences.cn: 除几枚便士硬币外, 还剩下九英镑。

sentences.en: He spends every penny he earns.
sentences.cn: 他把赚得的每一分钱都花掉了。

sentences.en: He's never turned an honest penny in his life.
sentences.cn: 他一生中没有用正当手段赚过一点钱。

jushi.english: I have five shillings and a few pence.
jushi.chinese: 我有五先令和几个便士。

jushi.english: I had but two pence in my pocket.
jushi.chinese: 我口袋里只有两个便士。

jushi.english: The journey won't cost you a penny if you come in my car.
jushi.chinese: 如果你坐我的车去,一分钱也不用花。
